titleStmt.title: Deaths deliverance, and Eliahes fiery charet, or The holy mans triumph after death Delivered in two sermons preached at Plymouth, the one the 16. the other the 19. of August: the former at the funerall of Thomas Sherwill, an eminent and pious magistrate of that place. 1631. By Alexander Grosse now pastor of Bridford.
titleStmt.author: Grosse, Alexander, 1596?-1654.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Thomas Paine, for Francis Eaglesfield, and are to be sold at the Marygold in Saint Pauls Church-yard,

notesStmt.note: The second sermon, "Eliahs fiery chariot or The holy mans triumph after death .. A sermon preached .. at the funerall of .. Matthias Nicols" has separate dated title page and pagination; register is continuous.
Reproduction of the original in the Union Theological Seminary (New York, N.Y.). Library.

place.placeName: the Marygold in Saint Pauls Church-yard
